intro: Ipomoea decemcornuta, commonly known as the Crown of Thorns, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Its leaves are typically small, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. The Crown of Thorns is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and hardy nature.
